com.defano.jmonet.transform.image

Class FloodFillTransform

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jmonet.transform.image.FloodFillTransform
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageTransform

    public class FloodFillTransform
extends Object
implements ImageTransform
    Performs a "flood fill" (sometimes called "seed fill" or "spill paint") of the image with a provided paint or texture. Terrible performance on very large fill surfaces. Given an origin point in the image, this algorithm iteratively paints every adjacent pixel with the given color or texture until it reaches a boundary pixel.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public BufferedImage apply(BufferedImage source)
        Applies a transform operation to the given image, producing a new, transformed image. This method does not destroy or otherwise mutate the source image. Note that this operation may return an image whose dimensions differ from the source image. See StaticImageTransform for a transform which maintains source dimensions.
        Specified by:
        apply in interface ImageTransform
        Parameters:
        source - The source image to which the transform should be applied.
        Returns:
        A new, transformed image.
